summary: This is a forwarded email chain regarding the resignation of U.S. Labor Secretary Alex Acosta due to mounting pressure related to his past handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email includes a link to a news article on the subject.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: He is resigning from his position as Labor Secretary due to pressure related to his past involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His case is cited as the reason for the mounting pressure leading to Alex Acosta's resignation.

connections.description: Acosta's resignation is directly linked to his past handling of the Epstein case, indicating a professional/legal connection as a prosecutor or official involved in the case.

events.title: Alex Acosta Resigns as Labor Secretary
events.description: U.S. Labor Secretary Alex Acosta resigns from his position due to mounting pressure related to his past involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: U.S. Labor Secretary Alex Acosta resigned on July 12, 2019.
The resignation was a direct result of mounting pressure related to his past handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The document is a forwarded email containing a link to a news article about the resignation.
